intro: Schickendantziella, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low, compact shrub with upright stems and clustered foliage. Schickendantziella species are popular as houseplants due to their ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. They thrive in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil.
